title.native: くまのがっこう ～ジャッキーとケイティ～
title.romaji: Kuma no Gakkou: Jackie to Katie

description:
The story follows 12 bear cubs living in a dormitory on the top of a mountain.

(Source: AniDB)

tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

title.native: がんばれ! ルルロロ
映画くまのがっこう パティシエ・ジャッキーとおひさまのスイーツ

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sna72860) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中村誠_(脚本家%29)

Affiliated with [Frontier Works](https://anilist.co/studio/61/).

Initially he was mainly a scriptwriter for radio programs, but ever since his involvement on [Kanon](https://anilist.co/anime/144/) in 2002, he has been working on animation-related projects as both scriptwriter and producer.

In 2010, he made his directorial debut with the puppet animation [Cheburashka](https://anilist.co/anime/9340/).

_Note: Not to be confused with [either](https://anilist.co/staff/134789/) of [the two](https://anilist.co/staff/265458/) animators._

Tetsurou Kodama is a director, computer graphics director and background artist. According to him, it was [Cannon Fodder](https://anilist.co/anime/1462/Memories/), a movie by [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872) that was a part of Memories movie anthology, that inspired him to start making anime. He was awarded several prizes for the original short animated movies such as "My Home" and "Running Man". Currently, he is the representative director of studio Echoes, and he engages in various projects for creating TV animation, previews and commercials.

Currently, he is the representative director of studio Echoes, and he engages in various projects for creating TV animation, previews and commercials.

[Website](http://kotringo.net/ktrng/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kotringo) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kotringo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kotringo717/)

Singer-songwriter, Composer and Pianist. She started playing piano when she was 5 years old. After graduating from KOYO SCHOOL OF MUSIC（current・KOYO SCHOOL OF MUSIC&DANCE), she went to study abroad in Boston, then graduated from Berklee College of Music with a Bachelor of Music in Jazz composition and a Bachelor of Music in Performance. In 2006, "Nichiyomachi (Waiting for Sunday)" which would become her 2nd single, was on air at the J-WAVE radio audition program "RADIO SAKAMOTO" navigated by Ryuichi Sakamoto, then she performed in "LOHAS CLASSIC Concert" also produced by Ryuichi Sakamoto. In the same year, she released "Konnichiwa mata ashita (Hello & See you)” produced by Ryuichi Sakamoto as her debut single in Japan. Since then, she has released 11 solo albums and 7 soundtrack albums. The latest solo album is “Ame no hakoniwa (My garden in the rain)” released in 2017. She composed the whole score in a long-running hit animated movie “Konosekai no Katasumi ni (In This Corner of the World)” released in November 2016, which led to her winning the 40th Japan Academy Film Prize for Outstanding Achievement in Music, the 71st Mainichi Film Awards for Best Music, and Best Music Award in the Osaka Cinema Festival 2017. Music of “In This Corner of the World” Concert, which represented the movie in a music concert, was well-received all over the country. At present, she has earned a high reputation as a singer-songwriter, composer and pianist with works on soundtracks for movies, dramas, animations, and commercials, and has a deeper expression of orchestra arrangements as well as performances. In recent years, the range of her voice expressions has expanded, including narration. In 2018, she visited Argentina on her first overseas tour, making all six performances a huge success and gained worldwide acclaim. She is now active as an artist who draws a pop world full of floating feelings with outstanding piano performance and soft singing voice.

[Website](http://kotringo.net/ktrng/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kotringo) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kotringo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kotringo717/)

Singer-songwriter, Composer and Pianist. She started playing piano when she was 5 years old. After graduating from KOYO SCHOOL OF MUSIC（current・KOYO SCHOOL OF MUSIC&DANCE), she went to study abroad in Boston, then graduated from Berklee College of Music with a Bachelor of Music in Jazz composition and a Bachelor of Music in Performance. In the same year, she released "Konnichiwa mata ashita (Hello & See you)” produced by Ryuichi Sakamoto as her debut single in Japan. Since then, she has released 11 solo albums and 7 soundtrack albums. The latest solo album is “Ame no hakoniwa (My garden in the rain)” released in 2017. She composed the whole score in a long-running hit animated movie “Konosekai no Katasumi ni (In This Corner of the World)” released in November 2016, which led to her winning the 40th Japan Academy Film Prize for Outstanding Achievement in Music, the 71st Mainichi Film Awards for Best Music, and Best Music Award in the Osaka Cinema Festival 2017. Music of “In This Corner of the World” Concert, which represented the movie in a music concert, was well-received all over the country. At present, she has earned a high reputation as a singer-songwriter, composer and pianist with works on soundtracks for movies, dramas, animations, and commercials, and has a deeper expression of orchestra arrangements as well as performances. In 2018, she visited Argentina on her first overseas tour, making all six performances a huge success and gained worldwide acclaim. She is now active as an artist who draws a pop world full of floating feelings with outstanding piano performance and soft singing voice.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kaieisha_nizo_y) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nizo_yamamoto/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山本二三)

One of Japan’s leading scenic artists and art directors. Noted for his work as an art director on titles such as [Future Boy Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/302/), [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), [Fantastic Children](https://anilist.co/anime/455/) and [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/).

He was also one fifth of [Princess Mononoke](https://anilist.co/anime/164/)'s art directors. In 1995, [Hayao Miyazaki](https://anilist.co/staff/96870/) went to the ancient forests of Yakushima, of Kyushu, an inspiration for the landscape of [Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind](https://anilist.co/anime/572/), and the mountains of Shirakami-Sanchi in northern Honshu for location scouting along with the five art directors and other production staff.

On August 19, 2023, he died of stomach cancer at his home, aged 70.

シルバニアファミリー
